metadata.Title: CVE-2023-37211 on Ubuntu 23.10 (mantic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Memory safety bugs present in Firefox 114, Firefox ESR 102.12, and Thunderbird 102.12. Some of these bugs showed evidence of memory corruption and we presume that with enough effort some of these could have been exploited to run arbitrary code. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 115, Firefox ESR < 102.13, and Thunderbird < 102.13.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-37211` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libmozjs-102-0 - 102.13.0-1
No subscription required

thunderbird - 1:102.13.0+build1-0ubuntu1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:102.13.0+build1-0ubuntu1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:102.13.0+build1-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:102.13.0+build1-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:102.13.0+build1-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:102.13.0+build1-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

notes.Note: tyhicks> mozjs contains a copy of the SpiderMonkey JavaScript engine mdeslaur> starting with Ubuntu 22.04, the firefox package is just a script that installs the Firefox snap

criterions.comment: mozjs102 package in mantic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '102.13.0-1').
thunderbird package in mantic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1:102.13.0+build1-0ubuntu1').
